text: I'm Eric Wilson of the New York Times
reporting from the fall fashion
collections being shown in Bryant Park
as it turns out for the last time after
this season the shows will be moving to
Lincoln Center in a new home in the fall
fashion week started out on a sad note
this season when designers learned of
the death of the great talent Alexander
McQueen apparently by suicide
nevertheless fashion we carried on and
hundreds of designer showed their fall
collections here at the park and in
venues around the city ladies and
gentlemen take your seats the show is
about to start thank you very much we've
seen a lot of interesting trends I think
the most notable is the return of
American sportswear that's largely a
layered look made up of a lot of pieces
like sweaters and coats piled one on top
of the other to create a new sense of
proportion in volume we've also seen a
lot of fur and coats that are made up of
lots of different materials in one piece
leggings have been surprisingly big this
year shown on the runways of Michael
Kors and Alexander Wang also chacune in
dragon bone
I think it's a strange season a lot of
gray a lot of new neutrals not totally
surprising for fall but one is some sort
of western thing going on that's been at
a lot of shows probably a kind of return
to roots which is sort of interesting as
opposed to something going more you know
techno or forward thinking not bad I
think I think people want comforting

it's been a funny season in terms of

dresses don't really matter to the

tell me love about what you think about

there's something about the real live
